{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3332191,"name":"John Slagel","username":"Novicaine","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ac8455/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T17:25:19.599Z","cooked":"

We’re having some troubles with our command-based autonomous sometimes not finishing commands we expect. So I started resorting to putting debug spew prints around the code like this:

// Spools the shooter to some RPM.  Exits when target RPM reached. Leaves the shooter running.
  public Command SpoolShooterTo(int botRPM, int topRPM ) {
    return new FunctionalCommand(
        () -> { System.out.print("SpoolShooterTo:Init\n"); this.run_shooter(botRPM,topRPM); },   // .7 .6
        () -> {
        }, // Execute
        interrupted -> { if (interrupted) { System.out.print("SpoolShooterTo:Abort\n");this.stop();} }, // End
        () -> ( this.atTargetRPM() ), // Is Finished
        this);
   
  }

Is there a better way to view what happened with the command states? Maybe the command scheduler outputs this somewhere?

No, this is not currently logged anywhere. Some attempts have been made (e.g. [cmd] Send composition members by Starlight220 · Pull Request #4735 · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub), but one of the challenges with doing so is that very few things are named when you use the fluent command builder approach, and the builder approach also creates pretty deeply nested command structures.

Thanks! I did find this in the docs that may help, which solves my problem for now:

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

The Command Scheduler

The CommandScheduler( Java, C++) is the class responsible for actually running commands. Each iteration (ordinarily once per 20ms), the scheduler polls all registered buttons, schedules commands fo...

// Set the scheduler to log Shuffleboard events for command initialize, interrupt, finish
    CommandScheduler.getInstance()
        .onCommandInitialize(
            command ->
                Shuffleboard.addEventMarker(
                    "Command initialized", command.getName(), EventImportance.kNormal));
    CommandScheduler.getInstance()
        .onCommandInterrupt(
            command ->
                Shuffleboard.addEventMarker(
                    "Command interrupted", command.getName(), EventImportance.kNormal));
    CommandScheduler.getInstance()
        .onCommandFinish(
            command ->
                Shuffleboard.addEventMarker(
                    "Command finished", command.getName(), EventImportance.kNormal));
